results.title: War generation: Beirut (D)
results.creator_credit: International Broadcasting Trust, MTC (Lebanon), BBC-TV, Jean Khalil Chamoun and Mai Masri
results.brief_description: An award winning documentary filmed by husband and wife team Jean Chamoun (Lebanese) and Mai Masri (Palestinian) which tells the story of three generations of young people whose lives have been dominated by civil war in a divided Beirut and who have become known as the “war generation”. 13-year-old Nidal does not know what peace means. Born in 1975 when the civil war began, he and many other children play games, war games, as they mimic their elders on the war-torn streets of Beirut. The city of Beirut is divided with the Christians living in East Beirut and the Muslims in West Beirut (made up of a large Palestinian and Shi-ite population) and what may have begun as a political war soon turned into a religious sectarian war. Continual bombings have destroyed much of the housing, there is no work, no schools and food is hard to come by. It would seem that most Lebanese, on both sides, are questioning this civil war. They are tired of the killing, the destruction and living in constant fear and constant danger. Through the frank and honest interviews and personal narratives contained in this documentary, we are given an unbiased, more intimate, perspective on the appalling everyday lives and struggles which took place in Lebanon during the war crisis where more than 150,000 people lost their lives, Christians and Muslims alike. Peace finally came to Beirut in 1990, although Israeli forces occupied southern Lebanon for many years on. A compelling and soul-searching documentary. Narrated by Margaret Magnusson.

results.title: War comes to America
results.creator_credit: Anatole Litvak, Frank Capra and United States. War Dept.
results.brief_description:
Episode number 7 of Series “Why we fight”.
Last in a series of documentaries made to inform members of the American Armed Forces of the causes and events leading up to the United States’ entry into World War II. This program concentrates upon America’s history of liberty, equality, and justice and how it is important for the country to protect this heritage in the face of German, Italian and Japanese aggression.

group_works.title: The Impact of the Second World War on Indonesian nationalism

results.title: War and peace = Jang aur aman
results.brief_description: Filmed over three tumultuous years in India, Pakistan, Japan and the USA, following nuclear tests in the Indian sub-continent “War and peace” documents a journey of peace activism in the face of global militarism and war. Examines the costs being extracted from citizens in the name of national security and the plight of residents living near the nuclear test site, as well as the horrendous effects of uranium mining on local indigenous populations. Filmmaker Anand Patwardhan presents ordinary Indians vying for peace and taking part in grass roots activism in light of India’s increased interest in nuclear power. He also examines the impact of American policy and the way in which American points of view (in particular ‘might is right’) has derailed the arguments about the perils of nuclear warfare. One segment is devoted to examining the legacy of Hiroshima and Nagasaki - which continue to remain contentious subjects for the US military. The Smithsonian Institute for example experienced conflict from the government when it mounted an exhibit about the after-effects of the nuclear manoeuvrings of World War 2. A post-credit sequence briefly addresses September 11 terrorist attack. This is an intelligent, insightful and important work. Awards: Grand Prize, 2002 Earth Vision Film Festival (Tokyo) ; Best Film, 2002 Mumbai International Film Festival (India) ; International Jury Prize, 2002 Mumbai International Film Festival (India) ; Critic’s Prize (FIPRESCI), 2002 Sydney International Film Festival; Best Film, 2002 Indian Documentary Producers Association’s (IDPA).

results.title: War and peace
results.creator_credit: Dino De Laurentiis, Ponti-De Laurentis, Paramount Pictures and King Vidor
results.brief_description: Based on Leo Tolstoy’s 20th Century masterpiece, it took a decade of preparation and two years of filming to produce this classic version. The personal stories of many characters, love affairs, and philosophies are woven throughout this massive and intricate tapestry of Russia during Napoleon’s invasion at the turn of the 19th Century. With great attention to detail and historical accuracy, this epic becomes an unforgettable document as well as a highly moving drama.

results.title: War against the rabbit
results.brief_description: Many farmers have relied too much on myxomatosis to control the rabbit. Other measures must also be adopted to completely eradicate the pest. The film describes how a farmer, in collaboration with the Vermin and Noxious Weeds Branch of CSIRO, tackles the problem of completely eradicating rabbits from his property.

results.title: War
results.brief_description: The narrator assume the role of the ‘universal soldier” who has been fighting for a million years and asks himself “why?” Asks and discuses questions like “have wars achieved anything?”, “what have soldiers and civilians died for?” and “why is every war bad?”

results.title: Wanted: dead or alive
results.creator_credit: RBC Entertainment, John Robinson, Ed Adamson, Thomas Carr and Harry Harris Jr
results.brief_description: This tape contains two episodes of the cult TV series, starring Steve McQueen as Josh Randall, the bounty hunter with a heart. In Episode 5 : “8 Cent reward”, on Christmas Eve a little boy seeks out Josh in a bar to search for a very special man, Santa Claus. Since he doesn’t want to disappoint the boy he tries to at least help him in some way - but even the best laid plans can fail. In Episode 6 : “The Choice”, Jane Koster asks Josh for help - her husband Frank is also a bounty hunter, but he isn’t as young or as fast as he used to be. He is trying to settle a score with a dangerous criminal and his wife fears he may be killed, sooner rather than later.
